p: Altogether, approximately 20 species of Hyptidinae were the focus of ethnobotanical studies, not just as medicinal plants but also as insecticidal or repellent agents. In fact, an article dating from 1950 reported that the whole plant Cantinoa americana (Aubl.) Harley & J.F.B.Pastore (syn. Hyptis spicigera Lam.), strongly aromatic, was used to ward off termites and mosquitoes ( Grindley, 1950). Some species have morphological similarities and are known by the same popular names ( Bordignon, 1990). Therefore, they may be used interchangeably by the population.
